meanings.sent1: She inherited a crore rupees from her grandfather.
meanings.sent2: The company made a crore dollars in profit last year.
meanings.sent3: It felt like a crore stars were shining in the night sky.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's speed was as fast as a crore lightning bolts.
meanings.sent5: The field stretched out for a crore miles, endless and vast.

meanings.definition: A unit of currency equal to ten million in the Indian numbering system.
meanings.sent1: He donated a crore to the charity for the new school building.
meanings.sent2: The price of the property was quoted in crores.
meanings.sent3: The shopkeeper jokingly asked if I had a crore to pay for the rare item.
meanings.sent4: In the bustling market, the noise was worth a crore whispers.
meanings.sent5: The value of friendship cannot be measured in crores, but in smiles shared.
